column4: Hi guys, does anyone know how I can revert my ath9k wireless driver that Ubuntu seems to have installed? I want the ath5k back but can't find it anywhere
-> remove it from /lib/modules/`uname -r`/kernel/drivers  perhaps? somewhere in that kernel/*  look for it and remove it
Yeah I can remove ath9k but I need the ath5k module
-> once you loaded the backports, did you find the ath5k  in those subdirs?
-> get the correct path, or I may give you the wrong info
-> moved it to same locations as where you have found the ath9k earlier,  i dont think it loads modules from updates/ subdir
But when I use modprobe it is saying that the module from 'updates' could not be loaded
-> modprobe command looks in a specific dir i believe, lest you provide full path
-> yeah you have to man insmod and modprobe to get the correct syntax and where it looks for these modules
it is finding the modules, just not loading them
-> if i recall, ath9k is the recommended one, but you have to google for the excerpts of these,
I haven't been using ah9k until recently, it just got updated. it does not support packet injection and I need that feature for some work I'm doing
-> not all wifi drivers support all the features, so yeah you have to go hunting for drivers that meets your needs
This is the correct driver, hence me trying to get it to work
-> i forget now, what is your chip? is its same as GratuitousEsq ? you guys have same chip?
I have no idea. The module I need is ath5k, definitely. It worked previously
